newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian base metals steady in range-bound trade.
newsitem.headline: Indian base metals steady in range-bound trade.

text.p: Indian base metals were steady in quiet trade on Friday, dealers said.
They said industrial demand was low but limited supplies of imported metals kept the market subdued.
Ready copper was steady at 12,350 rupees per quintal. Zinc and lead were unchanged at 6,400 rupees and 4,450 rupees respectively in thin trade, dealers said.
They said nickel was steady at 36,500 rupees per quintal and tin at 34,300 rupees per quintal. Aluminium was unchanged at 7,250 rupees per quintal.
Traders said sentiment was subdued at close on expectations of state-owned agencies would cut selling prices for January.
